intro: Psilocaulon ciliatum, commonly known as the fringed psilocaulon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are finely divided and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. While not psychoactive, it is often confused with other similar species due to its delicate foliage and flowering habit.
